1.title: Auto.ru
1.subtitle: "Auto.ru" App
1.descrMain: While working at Yandex in the Avto.ru team, I made a great contribution to the product development. My big product task was to create a new block with reviews from scratch, which I placed on all the main pages. Among other things, I redesigned the functionality of the outdated "Reset filters" block in the listing. I also integrated a platform for collecting feedback and participated in updating blocks with content on the main pages (reviews, the "Tests and overviews" block, product cards with an updated design, etc.).
1.descrSub: In addition to the above, I was engaged in optimization activities, including moving to new endpoints, fixing both minor and critical bugs, refactoring the code and writing unit tests, both standard and screenshot ones.

2.title: Data & Finance Technologies
2.subtitle: "Data & Finance Technologies" App
2.descrMain: Data & Finance Technologies is a financial application that can analyze real financial data. The application offers a set of flexible tools for interacting with data, formatting it, changing it, as well as for generating detailed reports in tabular and graphical forms.
2.descrSub: While working on this project, I was the only front-end developer and had full responsibility for the entire front-end component of the application. I supported a multi-page admin panel integrated with the backend, and also wrote new pages from scratch. In addition, I also wrote complex and multifunctional components with financial business logic based on components from third-party libraries (Material UI, Prime React, and Ant Design). I also refactored previously written code and restructured it.

3.title: Minesweeper
3.subtitle: "Minesweeper" Game
3.descrMain: This application is a copy of the iconic "Minesweeper", which I developed in 3 days on React using NextJS.
3.descrSub: The game consists of a 16x16 field and follows the classic rules: the left mouse button opens a cell, the right mouse button marks the cell with a flag. The game, according to all the canons, also has a counter of remaining mines and a timer. Victory occurs if the player successfully opens all the cells without bombs, marking the rest with flags. Well, if you are blown up by a mine, you can always start the game over.

4.title: English Puzzle
4.subtitle: "English Puzzle" Game
4.descrMain: This game is a simplified version of Duolingo. The main goal of the application is to improve English in an interactive game form.
4.descrSub: The game has six difficulty levels, each of which contains from 20 to 40 rounds. In each round, you have to collect logical sentences from randomly scattered words (Drag'n'Drop supported), and each word is a puzzle. Having collected ten sentences, you gain access to one of the iconic works of art. Depending on your level of English, you can use one of three hints, as well as skip a sentence. At the end of the round, you will see detailed statistics.

5.title: Nonograms
5.subtitle: "Nonograms" Game
5.descrMain: This game is my intermediate final project at one of the stages of training at RS School. It is an improved version of the popular Japanese puzzle.
5.descrSub: The application includes three difficulty levels, which differ in the size of the field and the complexity of the picture, but you can also choose a level randomly. You will not only have to solve Japanese crosswords, but also compete with yourself or with friends for a while, and the main feature of this application is a small trophy system straight from PlayStation. Can you unlock them all?

6.title: Coffee House
6.subtitle: "Coffee House" Site
6.descrMain: I marked up this simple website based on the Figma layout as part of my training at RS School.
6.descrSub: Full compliance with the layout with an error of no more than 3%. An adaptive mode for three devices (phone, tablet, desktop) is implemented, as well as an animated carousel, pagination and a price counter in vanilla JavaScript.

7.title: About this site
7.subtitle: More about this site
7.descrMain: Speaking of my portfolio, I can't help but mention the portfolio website you are currently on. It was also developed by me using Typescript and React.
7.descrSub: The website was originally written in vanilla JavaScript, but after successfully completing RS School, I completely rewrote it using a more technological stack and Server-Side Rendering (Next.js). The site's design was inspired by the Deus Ex universe, and the background animation was generated by AI.

info.text: Frontend development for me is, first and foremost, creativity, the perfect balance between intellectual work and the expression of emotions. Due to my empathy, I successfully find a common language with people and easily fit into a team. I strive to solve problems effectively and creatively, so I plan to achieve high performance indicators. I have the following qualities: determination, easy learning, organizational skills. I am constantly engaged in self-development.

0.name: Yandex
0.description: Creation and implementation of the visible part of the Auto.ru website, including the development of the user interface, its styling, ensuring interactivity and optimization for various devices.

1.name: Data & Finance Technologies
1.description: — Development of the Frontend part of a financial application consisting of a multi-page admin panel integrated with the backend. — Writing custom components based on components from third-party libraries (Material UI, Prime React and Ant Design). — Refactoring of previously written code, its restructuring.

2.name: Architectural design bureau
2.description: — Development of the client part of the corporate website from scratch. — Creation of adaptive and cross-browser interfaces that correspond to layouts and UX/UI requirements, as well as covering them with tests. — Implementation of client logic for processing forms. — Providing support and updating of the website by adding new functions and fixing bugs. — Optimization of website performance and loading.

3.name: Private Practice / Freelance
3.description: Development of both individual pages for websites and full-fledged multi-page websites and SPA applications (client part).

hobby.text: In my free time I play guitar and drums, and also run my YouTube channel

stack.0: Confident possession in HTML, SASS, Tailwind, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Redux + RTK Query, Webpack, Vite, NextUI (component library), NextIntl (internationalization), React Hook Form, Zod and Yup (form validation)
stack.1: Understanding of SSR concepts, confident possession in Next.js and experience with Remix
stack.2: Understanding of Rest API concept, experience with Websocket and GraphQL queries, as well as authentication tokens (FireBase)
stack.3: Experience writing unit tests in Jest
stack.4: Basic knowledge and experience with Node.js
stack.5: Clean and maintainable code, following the principles of KISS, DRY and YAGNI
